contentrichtext.text: {{about|the organization called Zutik|the [[ETA]] publication with the same name|Zutik (publication)}} [[Image:Zutik logo.png|frame|right|Zutik symbol.]] '''''Zutik''''' ({{lang-en|Standing}}) is a [[political party]] in [[Basque Country (autonomous community)|Basque Country]], [[Spain]]. Zutik was formed in 1991 through the merger of the [[Communist Movement of Euskadi|EMK]] and [[Liga Komunista Iraultzailea|LKI]] (the Basque branch of [[Revolutionary Communist League (Spain)|LCR]]). Within Zutik there is a current affiliated to the [[United Secretariat of the Fourth International]]. It has a branch in [[Navarre]] known as [[Batzarre]]. Zutik members have been candidates on electoral lists of [[Batasuna|Euskal Herritarrok]] (EH). In the [[Spanish general election, 2004]] in the [[Basque Autonomous Community]], Zutik contested together with [[Aralar Party|Aralar]] both Basque nationalist against the ETA violence. ==External links== * [http://www.zutik.org/ Official website] [[Category:Political parties in Basque Country]] [[Category:Political parties established in 1991]] {{Spain-party-stub}}
